com.storytron.swat.util

Class LineBreaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.swat.util.LineBreaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

    public class LineBreaker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
    A class to break string into lines.

    Each line contains a sequence of words defined by a pattern.

    Each line contains at most a word, or it is guaranteed that it will have less than a specified character length. 

       
 USAGE:
 
  for(String s : new LineBreaker(inputString,wordPattern,lineLength))
    System.out.println(s);
    Don't nest for loops iterating with the same LineBreaker. I mean, don't do this: 
      LineBreaker lb = new LineBreaker(inputString,wordPattern,lineLength);
  for(String s1 : lb)
        for(String s2 : lb) {
                System.out.println(s1);
                System.out.println(s2);
    }
    The following word pattern could be useful for you if you are trying to separate words. Breaks line "Great Text To Split" as "Great " "Text " "To " "Split" and "GreatTextToSplit" as "Great" "Text" "To" "Split" 
     "([^\\p{javaUpperCase}\\s]+)|(\\p{javaUpperCase}+[^\\p{javaUpperCase}\\s]*)|\\s+|\\S+"

    If you want to skip some invisible words like html tags, you must override the wordLength(String) method to return 0 for tags, and modify the word pattern to recognize html tags as words: 

     "(<[^>]*>)|([^\\p{javaUpperCase}<\\s]+)|(\\p{javaUpperCase}+[^\\p{javaUpperCase}<\\s]*)|\\s+|\\S+"

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineBreaker

        public LineBreaker(java.lang.String s,
                   java.lang.String regex,
                   int lineWidth)
        Constructs a LineBreaker. This can be thought of as a collection of strings. The concatenation of all of them is equal to s. Each string has only one word that matches pattern, or more words matching pattern and a also has a length less than lineWidth.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to break.
        regex - regular expression specifying the shape of words.
        lineWidth - the maximum length allowed for a line in characters (not pixels).

      • LineBreaker

        public LineBreaker(java.lang.String regex,
                   int lineWidth)
